title: Epigenetics, Experience and Responsibility: Implications for neurodevelopmental disorders
descriptions:
The proposed project, titled "Epigenetics, Experience and Responsibility: Implications for neurodevelopmental disorders", aims to explore the ethical implications of epigenetics on neurodevelopmental disorders such as Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD), Tourette Syndrome (TS), and Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD). The project will focus on key areas such as epigenetics, ethics, and neurodevelopmental disorders, and will examine influencing factors including social and physical environments. By investigating the conceptual changes in the understanding of innate/acquired, genetic/environmental, and biological/psychosocial factors, the project will utilize both theoretical and empirical investigation methods.

This research will target concepts related to capacity responsibility and normative responsibility, with a focus on professional stakeholders such as individuals with neurodevelopmental disorders and their families. The project, known as NEUROEPIGENETHICS, will contribute to a deeper understanding of the intersection between epigenetics and ethics in the context of neurodevelopmental disorders, ultimately aiming to inform responsible decision-making and care practices in this field.

The project will examine the influence of social and physical environments on the development of these disorders, as well as the interplay between innate/acquired, genetic/environmental, and biological/psychosocial factors. The investigation will employ both theoretical and empirical research methods to delve into the concepts of capacity responsibility and normative responsibility in professional stakeholders such as individuals with neurodevelopmental disorders and their families. By studying these conditions through an epigenetic lens, this project aims to contribute to a deeper understanding of the complex interactions between genetics, environment, and ethics in the context of neurodevelopmental disorders.
